en.Slide 2: Selection Sort is essentially a bubble sort except that the next largest value is remembered and the swap is done at the end of each pass

en.Slide 24: Thus, the number of comparisons is determined by the equation $\displaystyle\sum_{i=0}^{n-1}i = \frac{n(n-1)}{2}$  and hence, the number of comparisons is $\theta(n^2)$, while the number of swaps is $\theta(n)$
